intro: Tylophora capparidifolia, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to regions of South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Tylophora capparidifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
